        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * a product administrator, the systems will be migrated from their current
          
          
            
                 * a #product() administrator, the systems will be migrated from their current
          
      
    
    
  

But I am unsure if this macro works in normal Java

But I am unsure if this macro works in normal Java

I guess we could make it work, but currently - as far as I know - we are not actually building and publishing javadoc. And in general we would rather want to go away from using velocity, so I would probably not want to introduce this macro for being used in javadoc comments. Therefore I purposely chose to use just "product administrator" here, this way it should be valid in the context of Uyuni, but also downstream, while developers hopefully know what is meant (the current SAT_ADMIN aka satellite_admin in the DB).
Additionally I had the idea to actually replace satellite_admin throughout the DB and codebase with product_admin (or maybe something else?) to be more generic, while using "SUSE Manager Administrator" and "Uyuni Administrator" respectively in the UI. If we did this, that comment would not need to be updated, and the code itself would be product name agnostic. I would be curious to know your opinion about that?
As nobody read this I am fine with keeping it.

nodes.bodyText:
satellite_admin is the role label in DB. The text version is SUSE Manager Administrator.
So maybe we write not "#product() admin" but "#product() Administrator" ?
Here and below.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -60,7 +60,7 @@
      *
      * @xmlrpc.doc Set whether we should keeps roles assigned to users because of
      * their IPA groups even after they log in through a non-IPA method. Can only be
-     * called by a satellite_admin.
+     * called by a #product() admin.

nodes.bodyText: Thanks, I added another commit (6d4baa4) with those changes, turning also additional occurrences of Sat admin to product admin in javadoc.
